Text: Nikola Grbic, head coach of Serbia: “We have the wrong approach in the beginning of the game. We only start to play better in the third set. We have to improve a lot physically, technically and mentality for the next games”.

Dragan Stankovic, team captain of Serbia: “We did not play well the first two sets. After the third set we had our chances, but Brazil played really well. We have only three weeks practicing together as a team. I believe that we will improve a lot the next matches”.

Roberley Leonaldo, head coach of Brazil: “Serbia has really good middle blockers and we had some difficulties. However, I have to congratulate our players because we made two good games this week. Now we have to keep improving in the next matches”.

Murilo Endres, team captain of Brazil: “It was a good first week for us”, Murilo Endres said. “Today the team played better than yesterday, and it was important because we were able to swap the players around. Our setter William Arjona and our opposite spiker Wallace are used to play together in their club team and their mesh was decisive for us”.
8,000 people were here in Mineirinho to watch the match.

Brazil's next stop will be in São Bernardo do Campo where the South Americans will play Australia on June 5 and 7.

Serbia travel to Italy to face the eight-times FIVB World League winners in Pesaro on June 6 and Bologna on June 7.
Wallace (#4) was the top scorer fo the match with 19 points. Kovacevic (#2) comes right after him with 17 points.

The final score is Brazil 3-1 Serbia (25-18, 25-20, 19-25, 25-22). Despite the absence of Bernardo Rezende, Brazil managed to start FIVB World League with two victories. The South Americans counted on a passionated crowd, and the efficiency of Roberley "Rubinho" Leonaldo, who will replace Mr Rezende for this season's first ten matches.
The amount of errors was crucial to this match. The Serbians committed 39 and the Brazilians just 21.
The crowd go crazy, and the Brazilian players wave back happily.
Uros Kovacevic misses a crucial service! The Brazilians end the set 25-22, and win the match 3-1!
Riad makes his fourth block on the game. 23-20
Now is Serbian coach Nikola Grbic turn to call a time-out. Brazil is getting close to end the match 22-20.
Wallace uses his talent to score, the ball fell softly on the floor. 21-20
Rubinho calls a time-out. 20-20

Brazil: Lipe Fonteles in

Lucarelli out
Kovacevic woke up and scored. Brazil is ahead, 19-18.
Riad served well and scores. TTO 16-15
The Serbians equals the score after Murilo's error. 14-14
Riad, with a clean block, scores. 13-10
Wallace did not hesitate and spiked hard over Serbian defence. 12-10
Ivovic speeded up and scored. 9-8.
Murilo attacks and it is TTO with Brazil ahead, 8-6.
Triple block from Brazil stops Kovacevic. 7-4 for the hosts.
After fourth set's first long rally, Brazil scores with Lucarelli's hard hit. 5-3
Wallace was the third set's top scorer, with seven points
Ready for the fourth set
Lisinac strikes, and Serbia take a sigh of relief. 25-19. Brazil lead 2-1.
Brazilian coach Rubinho calls for a video challenge.
Brazil: Murilo is back on court

Brazil: Lipe Fonteles in

Murilo out
Three points in a row to Serbia and Rubinho asks for a Time-out 20-16
Another brick in Serbia's wall! Lisinac stops Murilo. 17-13.
Lisinac needed to try twice to finally score! TTO with Serbia ahead on the scoreboard 16-13

A miraculous save performed by Murilo excites the fans. Wallace spiked the counter-attack. The referee pointed Brazil's point but the Serbians asked for a video challange. And the second referee confirmed it in Brazils favour. 13-12
Wallace drops a bomb. Ace! Nikola Grbic calls a time out. 13-10
Kovacevic tries another hit, but Wallace stops him. 13-8
Grat serve by Podrascanin! 13-7
Murilo Endres scores, but Serbia still leads, 11-6
Brdjovic stops another Brazilian attempt 9-5
TTO Serbia is leading 8-4
Kovacevic serves and Lucarelli misses the reception. 7-3
Kovacevic is trying to bring Serbia back on tracks. And he scores once again. The europeans are ahead 5-3
Brazil started the third set with another líbero. Felipe is on court.
A 40 seconds really opens the third set. Serbia win it
The fans in the stands turned their cell phones on and into a starry mosaic in the Mineirinho
Riad speed up on air to scores and ends the second set in Brazil's favour. 25-20, and 2-0 to the home side
Evandro's first spike stops at Serbian wall. 24-20

Brazil: Evandro and Raphael in

Wallace and William out
The Serbians are having some troubles on court and making lots os errors. So far, Brazil has 20 points by opponent errors, while Serbia has only six.
Long rally, Murilo had to make a weird move to send the ball to the other side, but Kovacevic ended with a sharp spike! 18-14

Serbia: Brdjovic in 

Jovovic out
Kovacevic scores again. He is the best Serbian player of this match so far. 16-12
Starovic misses the service. TTO. 16-11
But the referee says it is Brazil's point. 15-11
Nikola Grbic asks the first video challange of this match.
Incredible save by Lucarelli, William Arjona passed the ball softly to the Serbian side, but Atanasijevic hesitate and it is Brazil's point. 14-9.
Atanasijevic does what he knows best: spiking! Brazil is  still ahead 13-9
Wallace comes from back court. 10-7
Lucarelli's counter-attack hits the floor. 9-6
What goes around comes around. Brazil is ahead now. 8-6 TTO
Uros Kovacevic was the first set's top scorer with five points
Sergio perfectly receives, Arjona sets and Wallace did not have any difficulty to score! Serbia is stil with an advantage. 4-2
Another great serve from Ivovic. Serbia starting strongly this set. 3-0.
Ivovic opens the scoring in the second set with an ace.
Lucarelli flies and scores to end the first set! Brazil 25-18 Serbia
William Arjona, Isac and Wallace are Sada Cruzeiro teammates, and we can see how it effects their efficiency on court. 23-17
Atanasijevic is in the house... 20-15
This is a top volleyball match! The two sides are working hard to avoid the ball hitting the floor. After a long rally, Brazilians score again. 19-14
Lisinac went really high to overcome the Brazilian block. 17-14
Post a picture on Instagram with #rumoaodeca and you may make it onto the Mineirinho's big screen.
Team Brazil dominates the set so far, 16- 11 TTO
The rally started with a nice service by Isac, but Serbia's defense worked well until Lucarelli finished it with a counter-attack. 15-11
Uros Kovacevic blocks Wallace. 12-10.
Isac stops Podrascanin 12-8
Podrascanin makes a silly mistake and the Serbians missed a chance to counter-attack. 10-8
Kovacevic scores twice. Serbia is awekening. 8-6
Riad was the best blocker at the Brazilian Superliga 14/15 and he shows why. TTO Brazil is leading 8-4.
Lisinac blocked Wallace attempt, but Brazil are ahead 5-4.
Atanasijevic's ankle is recovered. The oppositte is a very important member of Team Serbia.
Brazil's line-up - Wallace, William, Murilo, Lucarelli, Riad, Isac and the líbero Sérgio Santos. Coach: Roberley "Rubinho" Leonaldo
Serbia's line up - Atanasijevic, Jovovic, Uros Kovacevic, Lisinac, Podrascanin, Ivovic and the líbero Rosic. Coach: Nikola Grbic
Referees: first - Mohamed Shahmiri (IRI) and second Hernan Casmiquela (ARG)
The fans sing the anthems heartily...
Leadro Vissotto (Brazil's opposite) was last match's top scorer with 18 points. Who will be the top scorer this sunday?
The two teams are warming up, in few minutes we will start the action at Mineirinho. Who do you think will win this time?

Brazil's middle blocker Lucas Saatkamp is the best spiker so far in the FIVB World League 2015 group 1, with 76.47% success.

Sérgio Santos, the legendary libero, is the best receiver with 73,91% efficiency.

You can participate today... visit the FIVB social media accounts...

 Twitter

Facebook
Brazil are one of two teams to have been ever-present in the World League and will participate for a record equalling 26th time alongside Italy.
The Brazilian squad are on court. Lots of noise here for them, too.
The Serbians are coming on court to loud applause.
Brazil and Serbia meet for the  20th time in the World League. Serbia have won only three of the previous 19 meetings.
The second match between Brazil and Serbia will start in about an hour. The Brazilian fans are already getting inside the Mineirinho all dressed up for the occasion.
